name: unartistic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not good at creating or understanding art: Almost overnight, this previously unartistic individual had been transformed into a painter of large, complex, and highly original canvases. Even to an unartistic person like me, it would seem simple enough to personalize each house in an attractive way.
not skilfully or attractively made: The pictures, which at first seemed so appallingly or excitingly unartistic, in fact bear the hallmarks of modern art. These people seem to be quite happy to spray horrific and unartistic graffiti on memorials.
More examplesFewer examplesMy unartistic eye regarded the painting as something a child could have painted.Why is so much money being spent on these unartistic, tasteless ads?
